<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Since introduction of the [[Eden Editor]], scenario attributes can be configured in the editor itself, not only in the external Description.ext file. To access desired value independently on where it is stored, use the following commands instead:
* [[getMissionConfigValue]]
* [[getMissionConfig]]</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Warning</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>If your [[Description.ext]] file is empty, [[str]] [[missionConfigFile]] may report an empty string instead of the path to the file. You have to put at least one entry into your config.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''missionConfigFile'''

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Config]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[for]] "_i" [[from]] (0) [[to]] (([[count]] [[paramsArray]]) - 1) [[do]] {
	[[missionNamespace]] [[setVariable]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[configName]] (([[missionConfigFile]]/"Params") [[select]] _i), [[paramsArray]] [[select]] _i];
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> To define custom values in [[description.ext]]:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang=cpp</attr><inner>class myMissionConfig
{
    class mySetup
    {
        myNumber = 3;
        myArray[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
        myText = "LOL";
    };
};</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>

To read defined custom values from a script:
<code>_myNumber = [[getNumber]] ([[missionConfigFile]] [[gtgt|>>]] "myMissionConfig" [[gtgt|>>]] "mySetup" [[gtgt|>>]] "myNumber");<br><comment><!--
--></comment>_myArray = [[getArray]] ([[missionConfigFile]] [[gtgt|>>]] "myMissionConfig" [[gtgt|>>]] "mySetup" [[gtgt|>>]] "myArray");<br><comment><!--
--></comment>_myText = [[getText]] ([[missionConfigFile]] [[gtgt|>>]] "myMissionConfig" [[gtgt|>>]] "mySetup" [[gtgt|>>]] "myText");</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> To get file path with [[description.ext]] to play sound via [[playSound3D]]:
<code>MISSION_ROOT = [[str]] [[missionConfigFile]] [[select]] [0, [[count]] [[str]] [[missionConfigFile]] - 15];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[configClasses]], [[configProperties]], [[configFile]], [[campaignConfigFile]], [[config / name]], [[config greater greater name|config >> name]], [[configName]], [[count]], [[getArray]], [[getText]], [[getNumber]], [[inheritsFrom]], [[isArray]], [[isClass]], [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[select]], [[configHierarchy]], [[getMissionConfigValue]], [[getMissionPath]]

<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
[[missionConfigFile]] can be used to parse ''mission.sqm'' file data as well if it is included into [[description.ext]]:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class MissionSQM
{
	#include "mission.sqm"
};
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>
Then ''mission.sqm'' data can be accessed like this:
<code>[[getNumber]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "MissionSQM" >> "version"); //12 - version param in ''mission.sqm''</code>
(courtesy of [[Special:Contributions/Master85|Master85]])
</dd>
</dl>
